title: VRL’s stake sale in Vedanta not enough for stable rate outlook: S&P
description: S&P Global Ratings has deemed Vedanta Resources’ plan to sell its Indian-listed subsidiary stake, Vedanta Ltd, a credit-positive move but not enough to keep its rating outlook stable. The agency has changed Vedanta Resources’ outlook to “negative” from “stable” due to heightened refinancing risks, w…

title: Anil Agarwal meets with Ryan Reynolds, discuss Vedanta’s flagship program ‘Nand Ghar’
description: Vedanta Resources CEO Anil Agarwal met with Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds, who expressed interest in the Indian mining company’s Nand Ghar program that supports children and women. Agarwal was excited to meet Reynolds and found that they shared similar values after their conversation. Reynolds was p…

title: When Anil Agarwal met Ryan Reynolds - Anil Agarwal excited to meet Ryan Reynolds
description: Vedanta boss Anil Agarwal expressed his excitement about meeting Ryan Reynolds, known for his kindness and shared values. Anil Agarwal excited to meet Ryan Reynolds

title: Not So Keen On Any Other New Acquisitions: Tata Steel CEO T V Narendran
description: In June, Vedanta Ltd said it will immediately begin the review and evaluate a broad range of options including potential strategic sale of some or all of its steel businesses.

title: Tata Steel CEO TV Narendran says company not so keen on any other new acquisitions
description: Tata Steel CEO TV Narendran on Sunday said that the company, which is in an expansion mode in India, is not keen on any new acquisitions. According to PTI, ​the statement from Narendran has come amid Vedanta Ltd reviewing and evaluating its steel and steel-making raw materials businesses.

title: NCLT approves Vedanta’s bid to acquire Meenakshi Energy
description: The Anil Agarwal company offered ₹1,440 crore against admitted claims of ₹4,625 crore, equating to a 31% recovery, distributed among lenders, trade creditors and employees.

title: Vedanta gets NCLT nod to acquire Meenakshi Energy for ₹1,440 crore
description: Vedanta receives NCLT approval to acquire Meenakshi Energy for ₹1,440 crore. The debt-ridden company has a 1,000 MW coal-based power plant in Nellore, Andhra Pradesh. Vedanta will pay ₹312 crore upfront and balance ₹1,128 crore in 5 instalments over 5 years. Vedanta is a natural resources conglomera…

title: Anil Agarwal pledges to pay Zambia creditors $250 million before retaking mine
description: Vedanta Resources plans to pay the $250 million it owes to suppliers in Zambia once it regains control of the copper mines that were seized by the government over four years ago. The company’s founder, Anil Agarwal, has also pledged to invest $1 billion in the mines and double copper production. Zam…

title: Billionaire Agarwal Pledges to Pay Zambia Creditors Before Retaking Mine
description: Vedanta Resources Ltd. is ready to pay $250 million owed to suppliers in Zambia before the company resumes control of copper mines that were seized by the southern African nation’s government more than four years ago.

title: Vedanta Resources pledges to pay Zambia creditors before retaking mine
description: Vedanta to pay $250M to Zambia suppliers; Agarwal pledges $1B investment in copper mines. Company shares rise 1.3% as it looks to boost tax revenues, take advantage of surging demand for copper in clean energy transition. Agarwal: “Africa is my heart.”

title: Vedanta Resources appoints advisor to identify bondholders
description: A tranche of $1 billion, with a coupon of 13.875%, is due January next year and the remaining thereafter, which could put pressure on the group that recently sold a part of its stake in the local listed entity to meet repayments.

title: Vedanta stock falls 0.65% in weak market; Anil Agarwal-firm gets favourable ruling in oil block arbitration
description: Vedanta had initiated these arbitration proceedings after the government had sought additional share of profit from the company, while renewing its licence for the oil block in Rajasthan’s Barmer.

title: Anil Agrawal Says Vedanta Mulling Options To Spin Off Businesses
description: Agrawal said he has asked advisors to look into creating independent businesses with ‘independent management and the leadership’.

title: Vedanta head Anil Agarwal says mulling separately listing different businesses
description: In a video message to shareholders, Agarwal said the company has a diversified presence in oil and gas, metals and mining, and a separate listing of different businesses will help them grow many folds.

title: Vedanta plans to split each business into separate entities
description: Vedanta to split businesses, list them on exchanges for better focus on growth. Anil Agarwal-led Vedanta Group plans to split each of its businesses into separate companies and list them on exchanges for better focus on growth. Agarwal said that investors like pure play and all businesses can grow m…

title: Vedanta chairman mulls to split different businesses into separate companies
description: Vedanta Ltd. on Friday informed the stock exchanges that its Chairman Anil Agarwal had shared his idea with shareholders at a Chairman Townhall held on May 31, 2023 to split different businesses of Vedanta Ltd. into separate companies and get them listed for better valuation and to attract a new set…

title: Vedanta Wins Arbitration Against Government In $1.1 Billion Cost Disallowance Case
description: Vedanta has won an arbitration against a demand for a higher payout from its prolific Rajasthan oil and gas fields.

title: Anil Agarwal’s Vedanta wins arbitration against govt in $1.1 bn cost disallowance case
description: The government also sought its share from the oil and gas fields after the reallocation of certain costs between the fields in the block.

title: Vedanta wins arbitration against government in $1.1-billion cost disallowance case
description: Anil Agarwal’s Vedanta Ltd has won an arbitration against a demand for a higher payout from its prolific Rajasthan oil and gas fields.

title: Vedanta Seeks to Identify Bondholders as $2 Billion Debt Looms
description: Billionaire Anil Agarwal’s Vedanta Resources Ltd. said it has started an exercise to identify its dollar bondholders, as the miner prepares to repay about $2 billion of notes next year, a record annual amount for the company.

title: Vedanta ran covert lobbying campaign to weaken environmental laws: OCCRP
description: Vedanta accused of covertly lobbying to weaken environmental regulations during pandemic by OCCRP; Indian govt approved changes without public consultation; Vedanta pushed to increase mining production without new environmental approvals
